text: What's the recommended way to solve LP problems with `BigFloat` constraints and no objective function? `Tulip`+ `JuMP`? `Cosmo` + `Convex`? Something else?

elements.text: What's the recommended way to solve LP problems with

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/55167| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!

If you want BigFloat, you can’t use JuMP, but you can use big floats with Convex.jl, or directly with the library (most have their own interface). Not sure if COSMO supports big floats (I think it didn’t used to but might now). Tulip definitely does. What kind of constraints?

elements.text: If you want BigFloat, you can’t use JuMP, but you can use big floats with Convex.jl, or directly with the library (most have their own interface). Not sure if COSMO supports big floats (I think it didn’t used to but might now). Tulip definitely does. What kind of constraints?

text: (Tulip only supports linear constraints. COSMO supports a bunch of cones. The new solver Hypatia supports a bunch too and allows bigfloats AFAIK. SDPAFamily supports mostly SDP constraints and does big floats).

elements.text: (Tulip only supports linear constraints. COSMO supports a bunch of cones. The new solver Hypatia supports a bunch too and allows bigfloats AFAIK. SDPAFamily supports mostly SDP constraints and does big floats).

text: It's for <https://www.cs.rutgers.edu/~santosh.nagarakatte/papers/rlibm-popl-2021.pdf>. The constraints are `LB<= A*x <= UB` (constant `A`) where `LB` and `UB` differ by roughly `.0001`
I’d go with Tulip then, and personally I’d use Convex.jl but I’m the maintainer there so I’m biased

elements.text: I’d go with Tulip then, and personally I’d use Convex.jl but I’m the maintainer there so I’m biased

text: based on a little bit of experimentation, `Convex` looks great so far

```MathOptInterface.UnsupportedConstraint{MathOptInterface.VectorAffineFunction{Float64}, MathOptInterface.Zeros}: `MathOptInterface.VectorAffineFunction{Float64}`-in-`MathOptInterface.Zeros` constraint is not supported by the model```

with `problem = minimize(0, [0<=m*x, m*x<=1])`?
